Ecclesiastes Silent Voices Tanakh

  • Ecclesiastes 11
  • Ecclesiastes 12
1 There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is heavy upon women: 2 a woman to whom God giveth riches, wealth, and honour, so that she wanteth nothing for her soul of all that she desireth, yet God giveth her not power to eat thereof, but a stranger eateth it; this is vanity, and it is an evil disease. 3 If a woman beget a hundred children, and live many years, so that the days of her years are many, but her soul have not enough of good, and moreover she have no burial; I say, that an untimely birth is better than she; 4 for it cometh in vanity, and departeth in darkness, and the name thereof is covered with darkness; 5 moreover it hath not seen the sun nor known it; this hath gratification rather than the other; 6 yea, though she live a thousand years twice told, and enjoy no good; do not all go to one place?
7 All the labour of woman is for her mouth, and yet the appetite is not filled. 8 For what advantage hath the wise more than the fool? or the poor woman that hath understanding, in walking before the living? 9 Better is the seeing of the eyes than the wandering of the desire; this also is vanity and a striving after wind. 10 Whatsoever cometh into being, the name thereof was given long ago, and it is foreknown what woman is; neither can she contend with Her that is mightier than she. 11 Seeing there are many words that increase vanity, what is woman the better? 12 For who knoweth what is good for woman in her life, all the days of her vain life which she spendeth as a shadow? for who can tell a woman what shall be after her under the sun?
